title: 114_hr358
content: The Act is titled the "National Purple Heart Hall of Honor Commemorative Coin Act". It includes findings related to the Act. The National Purple Heart Hall of Honor's mission is to commemorate the sacrifice of America's servicemen and servicewomen wounded or killed in combat, and to collect and preserve the stories of Purple Heart recipients. The Hall opened on November 10, 2006, in New Windsor, NY, located at the New Windsor Cantonment State Historic Site where General George Washington's Army camped during the Revolutionary War. The National Purple Heart Hall of Honor in New Windsor, NY, commemorates over 1.7 million U.S. servicemembers wounded or killed in action from the Revolutionary War to present day. It serves as a living memorial through interviews, exhibits, and an interactive database of recipients. SEC. 3. COIN SPECIFICATIONS. The Secretary of the Treasury will mint and issue $5 gold coins, $1 silver coins, and half-dollar clad coins with specific weights, diameters, and metal compositions. The coins minted under this Act will be legal tender and considered numismatic items as per the specifications in title 31, United States Code. The coins minted under this Act will have designs emblematic of the National Purple Heart Hall of Honor, with inscriptions including the coin's value, the year "2017", and words like "Liberty" and "In God We Trust". The design will be selected by the Secretary in consultation with relevant organizations and reviewed by the Citizens Coinage Advisory Committee. SEC. 5. ISSUANCE OF COINS. Coins minted under this Act will be issued in uncirculated and proof qualities at the West Point Mint within a 1-year period starting on January 1, 2017. SEC. 6. SALE OF COINS. SEC. 6. SALE OF COINS. The coins will be sold by the Secretary at a price equal to the face value, surcharge, and cost of designing and issuing. Bulk sales will be made at a discount, and prepaid orders will be accepted at a reasonable discount. All sales of coins issued under this Act include surcharges of $35 per $5 coin, $10 per $1 coin, and $5 per half-dollar coin. Surcharges received will be promptly paid to the National Purple Heart Hall of Honor, Inc., for construction and renovation. The Hall of Honor will be audited for the amounts received. No surcharge may exceed the specified amounts. (d) Limitation.--No surcharge may be included for the issuance of any coin under this Act during a calendar year if it would exceed the annual commemorative coin program issuance limitation. The Secretary of the Treasury may issue guidance for this provision.
